intro: Paracaryum intermedium, commonly known as the intermediate paracaryum, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Its foliage is often used in traditional medicine, though its botanical significance lies in its ornamental value and ecological role in its native habitat.
